article:
'David Papineau' (born 1947) is an academic philosopher. He works as Professor
of Philosophy of Science at King's College London, having previously taught for
several years at Cambridge University and been a fellow of Robinson College,
Cambridge. He was born in Italy and grew up in Trinidad, England and South
Africa and currently lives in London with his wife, Rose Wild, and their two
children Katy and Louis.

Papineau received a BSc in mathematics from the University of Natal and a BA and
PhD in philosophy from the University of Cambridge. Papineau's works focus on
metaphysics, philosophy of science, and philosophy of mind. Papineau is well
known as a proponent of philosophical naturalism and realism.

Papineau was the President of the British Society for the Philosophy of Science
for 1993-5 and President of the Mind Association for 2009â10.
categories: Alumni of the University of Cambridge
